definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Attendees must pass through airport-like security.
sentences.chinese: 參加者必須通過機場式的安檢。

sentences.english: Players may wear a pair of thick socks and lights, soft-soled running shoes.
sentences.chinese: 參加者可穿一對厚襪子及輕而鞋底較軟的跑鞋。

sentences.english: The participants of the VIP card membership must fill in the following information. (If applicant requires a VIP card, please also fill in the below section).
sentences.chinese: 專匯醫療貴賓卡會籍參加者必須填妥以下資料。

sentences.english: These activities attracted an audience of 6434.
sentences.chinese: 這些活動吸引了6434名參加者。

sentences.english: Portugal is planning a helicopter NH90 heavy participants.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙是NH90重型直升飛機計劃一個參加者。

sentences.english: Only those who have a fair competence in English could enter into the programme.
sentences.chinese: 參加者必須在英文科達到指定要求，方有資格參加。

sentences.english: Details of participants (name & HKID/travel document number) must be submitted at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 負責領袖必須於遞交參加者中英姓名及證件號碼。

sentences.english: Confirmation letter will be sent to pre-registered participants.
sentences.chinese: 大會將發出確認函予優先報名參加者。

sentences.english: No refunds or transfers will be made after confirmation of registration.
sentences.chinese: 參加者在本會確認班別後不得轉班或退款。

sentences.english: Every man assembled knew that his presence meant a near-certain death sentence if the revolt failed.
sentences.chinese: 每一個參加者都清楚暴動失敗意味着必死的判決。

sentences.english: Participants were dressed in some 15-thousand costumes in 47 styles.
sentences.chinese: 參加者穿着在大約15萬的服裝，在47個樣式。

sentences.english: There is no restriction on the number of participants from each organisation.
sentences.chinese: 全程約九千米，參加者年齡不限。

sentences.english: Non-Discrimination Participants should be committed to a workforce free of harassment and unlawful discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 參加者應當承諾員工免受騷擾以及非法歧視。

sentences.english: Participants should bring their own sticks, mouth guard, shin pads.
sentences.chinese: 參加者需要自備球棍，牙箍，護脛。

sentences.english: Many of those who joined in it, uninvited, we did not even know.
sentences.chinese: 許多不請自來的參加者，我們連認都不認得。

sentences.english: Referred to the number of participants submitting the enrolment forms, not the number of sponsors.
sentences.chinese: 指交回表格之參加者，並非參加者之贊助人數。

definition: student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
to compete/to take part in a competition
to be present/to be on the scene
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
